dao

Interface CustomerDAO

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    CustomerDAOJDBC

    public interface CustomerDAO
    This interface represents a contract for a DAO for the Customer model. Note that all methods which returns the Customer from the DB, will not fill the model with the password, due to security reasons.
    Author:
    Ahmed Gamal

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void create(Customer Cutomer)
      Create the given Cutomer in the database.
      void delete(Customer Cutomer)
      Delete the given Cutomer from the database.
      boolean existEmail(java.lang.String email)
      Returns true if the given email address exist in the database.
      Customer find(java.lang.Long id)
      Returns the Cutomer from the database matching the given ID, otherwise null.
      Customer find(java.lang.String email)
      Returns the Cutomer from the database matching the given email and password, otherwise null.
      java.util.List<Customer> list()
      Returns a list of all Cutomers from the database ordered by Cutomer ID.
      void update(Customer Cutomer)
      Update the given Cutomer in the database.

    • Method Detail

      • find

        Customer find(java.lang.Long id)
       throws DAOException
        Returns the Cutomer from the database matching the given ID, otherwise null.
        Parameters:
        id - The ID of the Cutomer to be returned.
        Returns:
        The Cutomer from the database matching the given ID, otherwise null.
        Throws:
        DAOException - If something fails at database level.

      • find

        Customer find(java.lang.String email)
       throws DAOException
        Returns the Cutomer from the database matching the given email and password, otherwise null.
        Parameters:
        email - The email of the Cutomer to be returned.
        password - The password of the Cutomer to be returned.
        Returns:
        The Cutomer from the database matching the given email and password, otherwise null.
        Throws:
        DAOException - If something fails at database level.

      • list

        java.util.List<Customer> list()
                       throws DAOException
        Returns a list of all Cutomers from the database ordered by Cutomer ID. The list is never null and is empty when the database does not contain any Cutomer.
        Returns:
        A list of all Cutomers from the database ordered by Cutomer ID.
        Throws:
        DAOException - If something fails at database level.

      • create

        void create(Customer Cutomer)
     throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
            DAOException
        Create the given Cutomer in the database. The Cutomer ID must be null, otherwise it will throw IllegalArgumentException. After creating, the DAO will set the obtained ID in the given Cutomer.
        Parameters:
        Cutomer - The Cutomer to be created in the database.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the Cutomer ID is not null.
        DAOException - If something fails at database level.

      • update

        void update(Customer Cutomer)
     throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
            DAOException
        Update the given Cutomer in the database. The Cutomer ID must not be null, otherwise it will throw IllegalArgumentException. Note: the password will NOT be updated. Use changePassword() instead.
        Parameters:
        Cutomer - The Cutomer to be updated in the database.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the Cutomer ID is null.
        DAOException - If something fails at database level.

      • delete

        void delete(Customer Cutomer)
     throws DAOException
        Delete the given Cutomer from the database. After deleting, the DAO will set the ID of the given Cutomer to null.
        Parameters:
        Cutomer - The Cutomer to be deleted from the database.
        Throws:
        DAOException - If something fails at database level.

      • existEmail

        boolean existEmail(java.lang.String email)
            throws DAOException
        Returns true if the given email address exist in the database.
        Parameters:
        email - The email address which is to be checked in the database.
        Returns:
        True if the given email address exist in the database.
        Throws:
        DAOException - If something fails at database level.
